place.name: LLANANNO
place.gazetteerText: LLANANNO, a parish in Knighton district, Radnor; on the river Ithon, 10 miles N W by W of Rhayader r. station. Post town, Newtown, Montgomeryshire. Acres, 4,400. Real property, £1,590. Pop., 358. Houses, 60-Slight remains exist of Castle Dynbod, a very strong fortress, demolished in 1640 by Llewelyn ap Grufydd. There is a mineral spring. The living is a p. curacy, united with the p. curacy of Llanbadarn-Fynydd, in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £150. Patron, the Chancellor of Brecon Collegiate Church. The church is dedicated to St. Wonno. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
